oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The building block approach to unusual alpha-amino acid derivatives and peptides
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: constrained phenylalanine derivatives
miyaura coupling reaction
enyne metathesis reaction
diels-alder approach
organic-synthesis
tic derivatives
side-chain
metalated isocyanides
olefin metathesis
protein-structure
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The building block approach was identified as a useful alternative to the commonly used Bucherer-Berg method for the preparation of cyclic unusual alpha-amino acid derivatives. The symmetrical building blocks were prepared by dialkylation of ethyl isocyano-acetate under solid-liquid phase transfer catalysis conditions while the unsymmetrical building blocks were prepared by a stepwise alkylation of the O'Donnell Schiff base. Metathesis reactions, Suzuki couplings, and cycloaddition reactions were utilized to assemble the building blocks.
